questions.question: Who will look .............................. your pets when you are on holiday?
questions.description: To look after somebody is to take care of them.

questions.question: If we have time we will have a look ............................... the city.
questions.description: To look around a place is to explore it

questions.question: I will look ............................. all the applications before hiring someone.
questions.description: To look at something is to consider it or examine it.

questions.question: He is looking ............................. a hefty fine and jail term if he does not prove his innocence.
questions.description: To look at something is to face it or confront it.

questions.question: Tears roll down my cheeks, whenever I look ............................... on my childhood.
questions.description: To look back on something is to think about it.

questions.question: When they became rich they began to look ................................ their poor neighbors.
questions.description: To look down on somebody is to consider them inferior.

questions.question: Can you help me look ............................... my cat? She has been missing since morning.
questions.description: To look for somebody or something is to search for them or it.

questions.question: I am really looking ............................... to becoming a mother.
questions.description: To look forward to something is to be excited about something that will happen in the future.

questions.question: Julie looked ................................... us on her way home.
questions.description: To look in on somebody is to pay them a short visit.

questions.question: The supervisor has agreed to look ............................... the matter.
questions.description: To look into something is to investigate it.

questions.question: I looked ................................. as the children played in the park.
questions.description: To look on is to watch an activity without getting involved.

questions.question: Look ..........................! The floor is wet.
questions.description: This is an expression used to warn someone to be careful.
